descriptionHtml:
Ever wonder why Sinding mauled that little girl? A wolf loves a free meal, and Hircine loves "the hunt." So why stop there?

A Werewolf's Enlightenment seeks to enhance Werewolf gameplay by adding a little RP flavor. It also makes werewolves more compatible with mods, especially difficulty overhauls like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12452/?]Sands of Time[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27866/?]High Level Enemies[/url]. Oddly enough, it seems nobody actually took the time to scale werewolf armor and damage other than tacking on a few perks.



[size=5][b][u]Mod Components:

[/u][/b][/size][size=2][b][u]Hircine's Domination:[/u][/b] You may want to go attack someone, but your Werewolf instincts are telling you "FRESH MEAT!" So of course you gotta go eat that dead body. Hircine can't compel you to rage in the middle of a city, but he's not gonna let you off entirely.[/size][size=1]

[/size][size=2][b][u]Armor/Damage Scaling[/u][u]:[/u][/b] The beast within grows stronger as you yourself become tougher. As you level up or consume dead bodies, your beast form gains additional damage and/or armor. And don't worry, those hearts - I mean perks - you collected still add the usual benefit.

[b][u]Size Scaling:[/u][/b] You start off a small and timid Werewolf, but as you feed, your prowess and fearsome visage gr[/size]ows to match your body count.


Q.F.A.:

- All of the components can be toggled on or off, as well as tweaked to your liking.
- The mod itself can even be enabled or disabled in the middle of a game regardless of whether or not you are currently a werewolf.
- It is compatible with [b][i]everything [/i][/b]because I hate making compatibility patches. It literally edits [b][i]nothing[/i][/b] from the base game. There should be no conflicts.
- The core mod launches hundreds of scripts, but they load themselves into a callback array and then shut down. This is a method known as "caching" which helps cut down on script usage, and this is why it's compatible with Sands of Time, despite SoT's famous (no, not infamous) script burden.
- Q.F.A. stands for Questions, Facts, and Answers. I skimped on the questions part because reasons.
